body.name: Victrola Vintage 3-Speed Bluetooth Portable Suitcase Record Player with Built-in Speakers | Upgraded Turntable Audio Sound| Includes Extra Stylus | Turquoise, Model Number: VSC-550BT-TQ

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 hrs 54 mins
features: THREE SPEED BELT-DRIVEN TURNTABLE - This 3-speed (33 1/3, 45, 78 rpm) suitcase record player features UPGRADED PREMIUM SOUND QUALITY and sits on sound isolating feet that prevent vibration. It is perfect for your living room, bedroom or office.

TAKE YOUR TUNES ANYWHERE - Housed in a vintage suitcase with an easy carry handle, Victrola's blend of retro and contemporary design give you the ultimate flexibility to listen to music where you want and how you want – a great choice for vinyl lovers. Clean only with a dry cloth

EXPANDED CONNECTION OPTIONS - Stream smartphone audio through the turntable’s built-in Bluetooth speakers. Easily connect external speakers via the stereo RCA outputs, or use the Line input for non-Bluetooth devices like a CD player. For personal listening, connect your headphones to the headphone jack.

NO STEREO SYSTEM OR EXTRA EQUIPMENT REQUIRED. Get it up and running in minutes. Retro looks combined with the convenience of modern technology makes this affordable record player ideal for beginners & vintage enthusiasts
ALL THE CONTROLS YOU NEED - Features an Input select knob, Power/Volume Knob & an Auto stop switch that stops spinning records once the record is finished playing.

A RECORD PLAYER THAT SUITS YOUR PERSONALITY - Combined with Victrola’s unparalleled sound quality and exquisite craftsmanship, and a wide range of styles, patterns and colors to choose from, get ready to create lifelong music memories
body.description: The Victrola portable suitcase record players classic design lets you take your tunes anywhere! A portable design with convenient carry handle, 3-speed belt driven turntable and built-in Bluetooth speakers seamlessly play smartphone audio for all to enjoy! Additional features include a custom tuned Pre-Amp for improved audio clarity and bass performance, 3.5mm Aux-In, RCA outputs, and a headphone jack - all great features to enjoy your music at home or on the go!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: A True Classic The Journey Suitcase Record Player lets you make music memories anywhere

Premium Sound Victrola's Journey portable suitcase record player is a classic, loaded with features like an easy carry handle, so you can listen to your favorite turns wherever you are! Built-in stereo speakers provide crisp, clear sound, or you can plug in your favorite headphones and get lost in the music.

Quality Construction The Journey features a 3-speed, belt-driven turntable to reduce vibration, as well as wireless Bluetooth connectivity, so you can listen from up to 33 feet away. In your home or on the go, your music will never be far!

Plays all your favorite records The Journey features a 3-speed, belt-driven turntable for all your (33 1/3, 45, 78 RPM) records. Also features RCA jacks and a headphone jack Portable Design Easy-carry handle allows you to take your favorite songs on the go Bluetooth Technology Wireless Bluetooth connectivity lets you stream your music without any messy cords.

The Journey The Re-Spin The Revolution GO Turntable 3 speed, belt-driven turntable plays all your favorite 33 1/3, 45, and 78 RPM vinyl records. 3 speed, belt-driven turntable plays all your favorite 33 1/3, 45, and 78 RPM vinyl records. 3 speed, belt-driven turntable plays all your favorite 33 1/3, 45, and 78 RPM vinyl records. Speakers Built-in stereo speakers Built-in, custom-tuned stereo speaker enclosure with downward-facing bass radiator Built-in, custom-tuned stereo speaker enclosure Built-in, Rechargeable Battery ✓ Portability Move throughout your home with the easy-carry handle. Move throughout your home with the easy-carry handle. Built-in battery, retractable handle, and removable guitar strap allow you to take the Revolution GO anywhere you want. Built with Recycled Materials ✓ Bluetooth Connectivity ✓ ✓ ✓ Vinyl Stream Technology (Bluetooth Out) ✓ ✓ Inputs 3.5mm aux-in/headphone jack 3.5mm aux-in/headphone jack 3.5mm aux-in/headphone jack Outputs Built-in RCA jack Includes 3.5mm-to-RCA line out adaptor Built-in RCA jack Cartridge Victrola Ceramic Cartridge Victrola VND-08 Ceramic Cartridge Audio Technica AT-3600LA Moving Magnetic Cartridge

Specifications Turntable 3-speed belt driven turntable plays all your 33 1/3, 45, and 78 RPM records Construction The Journey features a stylish suitcase design, with easy-carry handle for portability Speakers Built-in, custom tuned stereo speakers deliver crisp, clear sound Inputs The Journey comes equipped with an aux-in, headphone jack, and RCA out Bluetooth The Journey features Bluetooth connectivity, allowing you to stream from your smart device without any messy wires In the box Manual, Turntable Operation Sheet, 5V, 1A Switching Power Supply, and 45 RPM Adaptor Dimensions 13.9x10.1x5 Weight 6 lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Suitcase Record Player
reviews.reviewText: This was bought for my son to get him started on vinyl. He is very musical and his range of music taste is fairly large as he skips from Simon and Garfunkle to Benny Goodman to Queen to Russian Electro-pop to Beethoven all in the same afternoon. He choose the tie-dye design because it was the most fun. The colors are clear and vibrant, just as pictured. The case is really nice and solid, decent latches and handle, nothing feels exceptionally cheap or breakable. It is a bit smaller than I thought it would be but it does run 3 speeds and the sound quality is great for a first time player. It is clear and fills the room with a smooth sound. I did not rate the bluetooth, because we haven't used it at all. He very much likes to play the records he has found or been given. The one thing that didn't come with was any extra needles or cleaning supplies for the records/record player. It does have a manual that describes what these items would be however.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great and affordable
reviews.reviewText: I love it! It looks cute! Works well. Slight wavy sound sometimes, but if I put it on a different surface, it can help.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use beginner record player!
reviews.reviewText: It's cute and easy to transport; it looks complicated, but after it is all setup, it's super easy to use. Great audio quality and plays my vinyls without issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It works, its not great, but thats fine by me
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. First off before I write this review let me just say I did a lot of research on this kind of record player and even a few of my own experiments so i would consider what i found to be pretty credible. I wish someone wrote a review like this for me when I was considering buying it.#1 Is this a good record player for beginners or people who only want a few records to play for the aesthetic? Absolutely. The sound quality is meh, but I mean what do you expect for $40. It plays the records no problems, and the bluetooth is great for just whenever.Now here is how you can upgrade your setup with minimal spending. Get an RCA to mini jack cable. Plug that into a speaker you already have or if in my case you have a practice amp cause you play an instrument, get a mini jack to 1/4 converter and plug it into the amp! It works great!#2 Will this ruin my records?No. It will not. I made a little scale and using pennies weighed out the tracking force to be around 5g. Now compared to $200 record players that track at 3g this seems like a lot. But be aware, when records were made, they were made to withstand up to 7 or 8g of tracking force cause lots of old players tracked at around 5 or 6g. Now tracking heavier like this will yes, wear them out faster, but it will NOT ruin them! The needle is also a diamond, so the needle is pretty decent actually.Now you can actually fix the tracking force on this thing. Get a small scale, like the kind to bake with, put your tone arm on it, get some pennies and nickels and start stacking them at the back of the tone are where the counterweight should be. One your tone arm reads at about 3.5-4g. Take those coins, tape them together, and tape them to the back of that tone arm. Maybe even go for around 4-4.5g because in my experience these cheap ones skip very easily.#3 Is it portable?Absolutely not. You need to plug it into an outlet, and it could totally break with some throwing around. Also the lid is completely useless.I took the lid off by unscrewing the screws on the back hinges. The lid is NOT big enough even when open to run 12" vinyls. The edge is right under your record, like millimeters under, and if you have ANY warping, at all it will hit the edge and cause it to skip. This is likely the problem a lot of people have when it skips and just don't know it. Just take the lid off its useless.#4 Does it skip? Does it sound weird?No, not at all. I had it skip on me once, and after replaying that section it never did it again. Probably was just my fault since i accidentally tapped the vinyl I was playing when getting it out of the sleeve. Also I tested the wow and flutter using a phone app. Let me tell you that it is BAD, like the wow and flutter is REALLY HIGH. But, even so, I didnt notice ANY sort of distortion in the sound. It might be worse when playing above 33rpm but at least for 33, its fine.#5 Is it worth the price?100% as long as you know what your getting. I didn't expect this player to be good or even great. Its okay at best and I'm fine with that cause its $40. If you are looking for a very nice player that delivers great sound quality, dont get this. If you want to really get into vinyl, dont get this. If you want to experience the most you can from your records, dont get this. If you want to just play a couple of records for cheap and have them in your room cause its cool and aesthetic, go ahead, im doin it for that exact reason.(Also, I purchased an amazon return and found no problems with it. Dont be afraid to purchase a used one for less, you can always return it if it is actually broken, but it will probably work anyway)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looks and sounds great!
reviews.reviewText: This record player is very well made. The quality is great for the price! It’s also has many different colors to choose from that make it appealing. I was worried about the size of the records fitting with the lid open, but it worked with ease the volume is loud and the sound quality is great too! Great purchase so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: i ordered this awhile ago and it worked fine at first but then the second time i went to use it the bluetooth stopped working and no sound was coming out. i spent a lot of money on this and was very disappointed. i still use it in my room for decoration but it would be nice if it actually worked. i’m also guessing if i used a real vinyl it wouldn’t make sound sense it comes from the speakers. let alone very disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than they say
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to casually get into collecting vinyl records, especially to play for family around Christmastime. I had a friend who recommended me one of these, and against my better judgement, I sought out other opinions online.It's insane how the vocal record vinyl community online is so hostile to these things. There's (disproven) claims about how it'll damage the records you play, claims that they're poorly built (no issues here), and lots of claims about the sound quality being tinny (again, not true).This thing (I got the red one) looks really nice and fits perfectly on a stand I built. The records play perfectly, the sound quality is really good considering the price. Maybe I have weird ears or something but I'm not hearing any tinny audio.I'm really glad I went with this purchase; it's gonna make Christmas this year feel really cozy! Don't listen to the gatekeepy pompous guys telling you how dangerous and bad these things are for your records. The whole "they'll damage your records!" thing is a disproven lie.Just go for it. You won't be disappointed!

My son is into retro things now he is a teen. Records are easy to find at the thrift store but a working record player is a little more difficult. This is a good entry level player for someone just getting into record listening. Sound is good and player has been durable so far.
We've been looking for something to play our old records on and this works great!! Sound is great.. can take it anywhere. We are so stoked to have this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little record player for my 10 year old.

reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Está de lo mejor, trae instructivo, cargador, funciona muy bien, tiene suave caída de la aguja, inclusive tiene la palanca para elevarla sin llegar a dañar el disco. El sonido es potente aunque con vibratos altos, nada que moleste. Los cassets entran fácil y tiene funciones de regresado de cinta con un solo click, e igualmente el sonido es muy bueno. Me encantó, lo recomiendo ampliamente.
Tiene muchas funcionalidades, llegó en perfecto estado
